step.context: \text{We know that }(x-1)\cdot(x-2) = x^2-3x + 2. \\ \text{But if }x^2-3x + 2= \left(x-a\right)^2 - b^2\text{ then } \\ \text{what are } a = ? \text{ and } b = ?
\text{Is the evaluation of the integral below correct?}
step.tex: \begin{align} \int\dfrac{dx}{\sqrt{(x-1)\cdot(x-2)}} &= \int\dfrac{dx}{\sqrt{\left(x-\frac{3}{2}\right)^2 - \frac{1}{2^2}}} \\ \text{If } t = x-\frac{3}{2}&\text{ and } b = \frac{1}{2},\text{ then }\\ \int\dfrac{dx}{\sqrt{(x-1)\cdot(x-2)}} &= \int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{t^2 - b^2}} \\ &= \log\vert t + \sqrt{t^2 - b^2} \vert + C \end{align}\\ \text{which, when we replace the values of }\\ t\text{ and } b\text{ gives us} \\ \qquad\log\left| \left(x-\frac{3}{2}\right)+ \sqrt{x^2-3x+2}\right| + C
